name: rexreplace
description: Flexible CLI regex replace in files.
author: Mathias Rangel Wulff

scripts.test: npm run build && npm run test-cli && npm run test-js
scripts.test-cli: npm uninstall -g rexreplace && npm -g install ./ && bash test/cli/run.sh
scripts.prepublishOnly: git pull && npm test && npm run load-options
scripts.postpublish: git add --all && git commit -m v$(node -e 'console.log(require(`./package.json`).version)') && git tag v$(node -e 'console.log(require(`./package.json`).version)') && git push && git push --tag && (open https://github.com/mathiasrw/rexreplace/releases || 1)
scripts.halt-on-changes: bash -c "[[ 0 == $(git diff --numstat -- ./src ':(exclude)package-lock.json' | wc -l | tr -d ' ') ]] && echo 'All good (No changes found)' && exit 0 || echo 'Oh! Changes found. Did you forget to ´npm run format´?' && git diff -- ./src ':(exclude)package-lock.json' | cat && exit 1"
scripts.test-format: npm run format && npm run halt-on-changes
